CDG.ActionRiskyThingDesc: Whenever an Agent does something that risks their life or their emotional stability.
CDG.ActionDarkDieDesc: When an Agent willingly exposes themselves to supernatural forces, disturbing imagery, or moral quandaries.
CDG.ActionFailureDesc: Describe a worse outcome for another Agent's action. If the result is higher than their highest die, their action fails in the way described.
CDG.ActionSelfCareDesc: When an Agent engages in a stress relieving activity, roll and reduce Stress by the result.
CDG.FailureRollContent: If your roll is higher than the other Agent's highest die, they fail, just as you described. If not, they succeed as before.
CDG.SelfCareRollContent: You engaged in Self Care. Your Stress was {previousstress}, your Stress has been reduced to {newstress}.
CDG.DialogDarkDieRollPositive: Your resolve is tested and holds up, for now...
CDG.RiskyDialogDesc: Do something that risks your life or emotional stability, choose all that apply:
CDG.DialogHumanDie: Human Die: If the action is humanly possible.
CDG.DialogOccupDie: Occupation Die: If the action falls under Agent's personal field of expertise.
CDG.DialogRiskDie: Dark Die: If the action would risk the Agent's physical or emotional well-being to succeed OR if the player would add an element of the horrific to an otherwise mundane task.
CDG.DialogRiskDieInsight: If the action would expose the Agent to Mythos Knowledge also risk their Insight.
CDG.StressContent: Your Stress increases! It was {previousstress}, now it is {newstress}.
CDG.InsightContent: Your Insight increases! It was {previousinsight}, now it is {newinsight}.
CDG.MaxDieMessage123: You barely succeed, but maybe not in the way they intended. The Handler determines how.
CDG.MaxDieMessage5: You succeed and may get an advantage. The Handler decides what it is.
CDG.MaxDieMessage6: You succeed brilliantly and get something extra. Maybe more than bargained for. The Handler may confront you with a difficult truth.
